title: Chikhaldara
subtitle: The only coffee-growing hill station in Maharashtra

paragraphs: Chikhaldara is a picturesque hill station located in the Amravati district of Maharashtra. It stands as the only coffee-growing region in the state and offers refreshing weather, panoramic viewpoints, and rich wildlife.

Nestled in the Satpura ranges, it is known for its serene landscapes, dense forests, waterfalls, and ancient forts. The town has mythological significance as it is believed to be where Bhima killed Keechaka during the Mahabharata era.
Ideal for nature lovers, photographers, and those seeking peace, Chikhaldara is a lesser-explored gem in the Vidarbha region.

highlights.title: Coffee Plantations
highlights.description: Only place in Maharashtra where coffee is cultivated.

highlights.title: Wildlife Viewing
highlights.description: Close to Melghat Tiger Reserve – rich in biodiversity.

highlights.title: Panoramic Views
highlights.description: Several viewpoints offering stunning sunrise/sunset views.

highlights.title: Lush Forests
highlights.description: Perfect for jungle walks and monsoon treks.

geography.intro: Situated at an elevation of 1,100 meters, Chikhaldara lies in the Satpura hill ranges in northeastern Maharashtra, near the border of Madhya Pradesh.

climate.description: Chikhaldara enjoys cool temperatures throughout the year, with foggy monsoons and crisp winters. Ideal time to visit: July to February.

geography.conclusion: With abundant greenery, lakes, and viewpoints, Chikhaldara offers a perfect escape for nature enthusiasts and photographers.

activities.title: Jungle Walks
activities.description: Explore forest trails rich in flora and fauna.
info: Best during monsoon and early winter

activities.title: Wildlife Safari
activities.description: Visit nearby Melghat Tiger Reserve for tiger and bird sightings.

activities.title: Photography
activities.description: Capture misty hills, lakes, and ancient ruins.

attractions.title: Gavilgad Fort
attractions.description: Ancient hilltop fort with panoramic views and Mughal-era ruins.

attractions.title: Bhimkund
attractions.description: Sacred natural water tank believed to be linked to Bhima from Mahabharata.

attractions.title: Mozari Point
attractions.description: Cliffside viewpoint with deep valley views and breezy winds.

attractions.title: Melghat Tiger Reserve
attractions.description: Protected wildlife sanctuary home to tigers, leopards, and sloth bears.

marineLife.intro: Being an inland hill region, Chikhaldara does not have marine life but offers rich biodiversity through its forest and freshwater ecosystems.

items.title: Bird Species
items.description: Home to peacocks, hornbills, eagles, and migratory birds.

items.title: Forest Fauna
items.description: Includes wild boars, deer, and smaller mammals.

conclusion: Chikhaldara’s natural terrain supports sustainable eco-tourism.
Its cool forests and diverse species make it a must-visit for nature explorers.

howToReach.title: By Road
details: 230 km from Nagpur, 80 km from Amravati
State transport and private taxis available

howToReach.title: By Train
details: From there, buses or cabs to Chikhaldara

bookingTips.description: Plan weekend stays ahead during Diwali and monsoon breaks
Book safaris to Melghat Tiger Reserve early
Fog is frequent – carry warm clothing and torches
